meanings.definition: Stubbornness or inflexibility in attitude or opinion.
meanings.sent1: Her obstinateness in refusing to compromise led to a stalemate in negotiations.
meanings.sent2: His obstinateness made it challenging to convince him to try a different approach.
meanings.sent3: Despite her obstinateness, we couldn't help but admire her unwavering dedication to her beliefs.
meanings.sent4: The obstinateness of the old tree roots made it nearly impossible to remove them from the ground.
meanings.sent5: The child's obstinateness in wanting the same bedtime story every night became a nightly routine.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being difficult to control or overcome.
meanings.sent1: The obstinateness of the wild horse made it a challenge for the trainer to tame it.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with the obstinateness of the old computer system proved to be a frustrating task.
meanings.sent3: The obstinateness of the crossword puzzle had everyone scratching their heads in confusion.
meanings.sent4: Overcoming the obstinateness of the rusty lock required some extra strength and patience.
meanings.sent5: The obstinateness of the weeds in the garden made it a constant battle to keep them under control.
